coverage_summary: Your House home insurance protects against loss or damage to Buildings and/or Contents, covering fire, flood, storm, theft and subsidence as described in the policy booklet.
key_inclusions: Loss or damage to structure of home including garages and outbuildings
Cost of alternative accommodation and loss of rent if home uninhabitable
Accidental damage to fixed glass and sanitary fittings
Replacement of external door locks if keys lost or stolen
Sourcing domestic water leaks damaging the home including making good
Public liability for homeowner legal liability
Loss or damage to contents in home, garages, outbuildings or gardens
Accidental damage to audio, video and computer equipment
Damage to freezer food from temperature changes
Tenant's liability for damage to landlord's property
key_exclusions: Damage from wear and tear, electrical and mechanical breakdown, or gradual deterioration
Storm damage to fences, gates and hedges
Losses and damage from burst pipes when home unoccupied for more than 60 days
Theft or malicious damage caused by policyholder, paying guests or tenants
Cost of replacing undamaged items that form part of a pair, set or suite
Motorised vehicles, aircraft, boats, boards, caravans or trailers
Property used for business or profession (except certain home office equipment under contents) unless specifically agreed
Damage from chewing, scratching or fouling by domestic animals (unless accidental damage cover purchased)
Damage to certain sports equipment while in use (under personal belongings unless purchased)

coverage_limits.buildings_and_contents: Maximum amount shown on schedule for rebuilding home and/or replacing contents

sub_limits.note: Monetary limits for certain covers apply - specific amounts to be found in full policy booklet

special_conditions: Must take reasonable care to give complete and accurate answers to questions
Must tell insurance adviser immediately if information changes
Must observe and fulfil all terms, provisions, conditions and clauses - failure could affect cover
Must report any event which might lead to a claim as soon as possible
For Family Legal Protection, lawyer must believe you are likely to win the case
Conditions apply if you want to nominate your own lawyer for legal protection
Pedal cycles only covered against theft if properly secured when unattended
Some accidental damage options don't cover damage when home is lent, let, sub-let or used by paying guests
excess_deductible: An excess (the amount you have to pay on any claim) applies - specific amount shown on schedule
geographical_coverage: At the home being insured within United Kingdom, Channel Islands or Isle of Man. Optional personal belongings cover applies anywhere in the world. Optional accidental damage cover only applies inside home including gardens and outbuildings.
cancellation_policy: Can cancel within 14 days of purchase or renewal (or from day you receive policy/renewal documents if later). Can also cancel at any time during coverage period. Full refund if cancelled before cover starts. Reduced refund (pro-rated for time covered) if cancelled after cover starts. Contact insurance adviser to cancel.

endorsements.name: Buildings Accidental Damage Extension
endorsements.description: Covers the whole building for accidental damage
endorsements.coverage_impact: Extends coverage to accidental damage to entire building structure. Does not cover damage from chewing, scratching or fouling by domestic animals. May not cover damage when home is lent, let, sub-let or used by paying guests.

endorsements.name: Contents Accidental Damage Extension
endorsements.description: Covers most contents for accidental damage
endorsements.coverage_impact: Extends coverage to accidental damage to most contents. Does not cover damage from chewing, scratching or fouling by domestic animals. May not cover damage when home is lent, let, sub-let or used by paying guests.

endorsements.name: Personal Belongings
endorsements.description: Worldwide cover against theft, accidental loss or damage for items such as clothing, mobile phones, tablets, handbags and money
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds worldwide coverage for personal items. Does not cover skis, boards, sub-aqua equipment and riding tack unless specifically agreed. Does not cover damage to certain sports equipment while in use. Limitations apply to items stolen from unattended vehicle.

endorsements.name: Pedal Cycles
endorsements.description: Worldwide cover for theft, loss or damage of family's bikes
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds worldwide coverage for bicycles. Only covers theft if bikes are properly secured when unattended.

endorsements.name: Family Legal Protection
endorsements.description: Helps policyholder and family members living with them pursue or defend legal disputes
endorsements.coverage_impact: Will only accept claim if Aviva's lawyer believes you are likely to win the case. Conditions apply if you want to nominate your own lawyer to represent you.

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: Must tell us about any event which might lead to a claim as soon as possible
required_documents: Information as specified by Aviva to achieve settlement
Full details available in General Conditions section of policy booklet
process_steps: Report event that might lead to claim as soon as possible
Aviva will tell you what information is needed
Follow procedures outlined in General Conditions section of policy booklet
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Specific evidence requirements detailed in General Conditions section of policy booklet

eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Property used for business or profession not covered (except certain home office equipment under contents cover) unless specifically agreed with insurer
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Home must be within United Kingdom, Channel Islands or Isle of Man
other_restrictions: Must not be letting or sub-letting home without appropriate coverage
Must not have paying guests without considering impact on coverage
Home must not be unoccupied for more than 60 days for certain coverages

policy_definitions.unoccupied: Not defined explicitly but home unoccupied for more than 60 days affects certain coverages (e.g. burst pipes)
policy_definitions.paying_guests: Guests who pay to stay at the property - certain losses or damage caused by them are excluded
policy_definitions.tenants: People renting the property - certain losses or damage caused by them are excluded, though tenant's liability is covered separately
policy_definitions.home: The insured property including garages, outbuildings and gardens within UK, Channel Islands or Isle of Man
policy_definitions.buildings: Structure of the home including garages and outbuildings
policy_definitions.contents: Items in the home, garages, outbuildings or gardens
policy_definitions.personal belongings: Items such as clothing, mobile phones, tablets, handbags and money (optional cover)
policy_definitions.excess: The amount you have to pay on any claim

time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Must report any event which might lead to a claim as soon as possible. Must tell insurance adviser immediately if information changes.
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: Not specified in this document - refer to General Conditions in policy booklet
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from purchase or renewal (or from day you receive policy or renewal documents, if later) to cancel with full refund if cancelled before cover starts

regulatory_compliance.fair_treatment_obligations: Must take reasonable care to give complete and accurate answers to questions. Insurer will tell you what information needed to achieve claim settlement.
regulatory_compliance.complaints_process: Not specified in this summary document - refer to full policy booklet
regulatory_warnings: You must take reasonable care to give us complete and accurate answers to any questions we ask
Please tell your insurance adviser immediately if information changes
Failure to observe and fulfil policy terms could affect your cover

common_questions.question: What happens if my home is unoccupied for more than 60 days?
common_questions.answer: Certain losses and damage (e.g. from burst pipes) to buildings or contents are not covered when your home is unoccupied for more than 60 days
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured - Buildings and Contents exclusions

common_questions.question: Are my bicycles covered?
common_questions.answer: Basic policy does not cover bicycles. You can purchase optional Pedal Cycles cover for worldwide coverage against theft, loss or damage, but bikes must be properly secured when unattended for theft to be covered
common_questions.section_reference: Optional cover - Pedal Cycles; Restrictions on cover

common_questions.question: Can I use part of my home for business?
common_questions.answer: Property used for business or profession is not covered except certain home office equipment under contents cover, unless you have specifically agreed this with Aviva
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover

common_questions.question: What if I rent out my property or have paying guests?
common_questions.answer: Certain losses or damage (e.g. theft or malicious damage) caused by paying guests or tenants are excluded. Some accidental damage options don't cover damage when home is lent, let, sub-let or used by paying guests. You should inform your insurer about letting arrangements.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured; Are there any restrictions on cover

common_questions.question: Are fences and gates covered for storm damage?
common_questions.answer: No, storm damage to fences, gates and hedges is specifically excluded from coverage

common_questions.question: If part of a matching set is damaged, will you replace the whole set?
common_questions.answer: No, the cost of replacing undamaged items that form part of a pair, set or suite is not covered

common_questions.question: How do I pay for this insurance?
common_questions.answer: You can pay monthly or all at once by credit/debit card or direct debit. If you pay monthly, a credit charge will apply. Discuss payment options with your insurance adviser.
common_questions.section_reference: When and how do I pay

common_questions.question: What if I need to cancel my policy?
common_questions.answer: You can cancel within 14 days of purchase/renewal for full refund (if before cover starts) or pro-rated refund (if after cover starts). You can also cancel anytime during coverage with pro-rated refund. Contact your insurance adviser to cancel.
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract

common_questions.question: Are my belongings covered when I travel abroad?
common_questions.answer: Standard policy only covers home within UK, Channel Islands or Isle of Man. You need to purchase optional Personal Belongings cover for worldwide coverage of items like clothing, mobile phones, tablets, handbags and money
common_questions.section_reference: Where am I covered; Optional cover - Personal Belongings

common_questions.question: What is the excess and how much do I pay?
common_questions.answer: The excess is the amount you have to pay on any claim. The specific excess amount will be shown on your schedule
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover

common_questions.question: Is water leak detection covered?
common_questions.answer: Yes, under Buildings cover, the policy covers sourcing a domestic water leak which is damaging the home, including making good after the leak has been fixed

common_questions.question: What about damage from my pet?
common_questions.answer: Damage from chewing, scratching or fouling by domestic animals is excluded unless you purchase optional Accidental Damage cover
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured - Optional cover; Optional cover - Accidental damage extension
